A distinct Pittsburgh landmark, constructed in 1921 in the midst of the downtown skyline and the Monongahela River, Terminal 21 originated as a focal point where produce and livestock met rail and industrial industries. The decades have seen this freight terminal and warehouse shift in focus to residential living, and its industrial form has long resonated with visitors and residents.Originally put to a different, industrial use, but now re-purposed to meet the current needs of a constantly evolving city, Terminal 21 fits with Pittsburghs culture of reinvention. Industry was once the heart that drove the energy of the city. Now, the emerging technological economy means room for growth within the community and for the professionals who live in it.With a comfortable modern feel inspired by the sites local heritage and history, Terminal 21 allows you to make the most of urban living. Centrally located, and primed for easy access to attractions and events throughout the city, Terminal 21 is still the center of a vibrant community and a welcoming stop on lifes journey.

The Brix at 26, a Hudson Property, ties historic architecture and modern, upscale boutique living, while offering residents immediate access to the luxuries of the Southside Works area of Pittsburgh. A distinct Pittsburgh landmark, constructed in 1921 in the midst of the downtown skyline and the Monongahela River, Terminal 21 originated as a focal point where produce and livestock met rail and industrial industries. The decades have seen this freight terminal and warehouse shift in focus to residential living, and its industrial form has long resonated with visitors and residents.Originally put to a different, industrial use, but now re-purposed to meet the current needs of a constantly evolving city, Terminal 21 fits with Pittsburghs culture of reinvention. Industry was once the heart that drove the energy of the city. Now, the emerging technological economy means room for growth within the community and for the professionals who live in it.With a comfortable modern feel inspired by the sites local heritage and history, Terminal 21 allows you to make the most of urban living. Centrally located, and primed for easy access to attractions and events throughout the city, Terminal 21 is still the center of a vibrant community and a welcoming stop on lifes journey.

We offer one and two bedroom apartments equipped with private balconies or patios, in apartment washers and dryers and wood burning fireplaces in select units. The clubhouse is ideal for gatherings and features a big screen TV, bar, indoor hot tub and swimming pool. Other amenities include a lighted tennis court, racquetball court, basketball courts and a fitness center. Located just off of McKnight Road, shopping and dining are only minutes away. Commuters will find our community ideal since it is only 15 minutes from downtown Pittsburgh. The office is open 7 days a week for the convenience of our residents and prospective residents. Our friendly staff is available to answer any questions and to make your move as easy as possible. Contact us today to arrange a tour.

Built in 1928 as a hotel originally and remodeled into apartments mid-century, the building has 7 stories, 1 passenger elevator, 1 freight elevator, 2 stairwells. Tall ceilings and hardwood floors throughout. The unit includes a private porch and entry room on the first floor. The unit is mainly on the second and third floor of the house. There are 5 large bedrooms with a full bathroom on each floor. There is also a shared living room and kitchen. The kitchen is large and includes a fridge, dishwasher, full gas range, double sinks, garbage disposal and flexible kitchen faucet.

Shadyside Commons offers newly renovated 1- and 2- bedroom apartments that combine a contemporary living space with a peaceful environment in the coveted Shadyside neighborhood of Pittsburgh. Built in 1903, the building was constructed as a hardware store for Pittsburgh businessman John Bindle and, over a century later, the 4-story brick building still flaunts its unusually sharp style and quality details. Large brick arches, handsome cornices and oversized industrial windows couple with proximity to downtown Pittsburgh to create your perfect luxury residence. Apartments include modern kitchens and baths, ample closet space with adjustable shelving and custom storage, and in-suite washers \u0026 dryers. Located near the University of Pittsburgh, UPMC-Shadyside, and Carnegie Mellon, Shadyside Commons offers easy access to the city\u0027s parks, shopping, and restaurants, in the vibrant, yet cozy residential neighborhood of Shadyside. Originally known as the Commonwealth Trust Bank, this historic tower has been serving the people of Downtown Pittsburgh for over a hundred years. Today, the building has been reborn—with stunning, light-filled modern apartment homes and amazing amenities, all within a timeless monument right in Pittsburgh’s Fourth Avenue Historic District. Throughout the iconic tower, you’ll find some of the best amenity spaces in Pittsburgh. A distinct Pittsburgh landmark, constructed in 1921 in the midst of the downtown skyline and the Monongahela River, Terminal 21 originated as a focal point where produce and livestock met rail and industrial industries. The decades have seen this freight terminal and warehouse shift in focus to residential living, and its industrial form has long resonated with visitors and residents.Originally put to a different, industrial use, but now re-purposed to meet the current needs of a constantly evolving city, Terminal 21 fits with Pittsburghs culture of reinvention. Industry was once the heart that drove the energy of the city. Now, the emerging technological economy means room for growth within the community and for the professionals who live in it.With a comfortable modern feel inspired by the sites local heritage and history, Terminal 21 allows you to make the most of urban living. Centrally located, and primed for easy access to attractions and events throughout the city, Terminal 21 is still the center of a vibrant community and a welcoming stop on lifes journey.

Originally known as the Commonwealth Trust Bank, this historic tower has been serving the people of Downtown Pittsburgh for over a hundred years. Today, the building has been reborn—with stunning, light-filled modern apartment homes and amazing amenities, all within a timeless monument right in Pittsburgh’s Fourth Avenue Historic District. Throughout the iconic tower, you’ll find some of the best amenity spaces in Pittsburgh. Come explore, and you’ll find a stunning outdoor roof terrace, a 2-story club \u0026 game room, and even a bicycle garage tucked away in the bank’s original vault. With a completely reimagined interior and unbelievable skyline and river views, The Commonwealth Building has become home to stunning boutique living spaces that combine the best of both worlds—old-world craftsmanship, with modern simplicity and style. Clubroom, Den, Library/Billiards Room, On-site Management, Package Lockers, Roofdeck with Grilling Station, Storage Lockers, Terrace

Shadyside Commons offers newly renovated 1- and 2- bedroom apartments that combine a contemporary living space with a peaceful environment in the coveted Shadyside neighborhood of Pittsburgh. Built in 1903, the building was constructed as a hardware store for Pittsburgh businessman John Bindle and, over a century later, the 4-story brick building still flaunts its unusually sharp style and quality details. Apartments include modern kitchens and baths, ample closet space with adjustable shelving and custom storage, and in-suite washers \u0026 dryers. Hobart Court is a no-brainer if you're looking for a comfortable apartment in an ideal location. The building has attractive curb appeal with well-kept landscaping and outdoor space in the courtyard. It holds one and two bedroom units with a handful of different floor plans to choose from. Most units have up-to-date kitchens and bathrooms, large living areas, as well as considerably bright windows. Some units feature original fireplaces, wood-inspired flooring, and ample closet space. Hobart Court has all the makings of a cozy apartment, and the location is the cherry on top! Only five minutes from the campuses of PITT and CMU, just down the road from Schenley Park, and within walking distance to Squirrel Hill's main strip, Murray Ave, you can easily walk to the grocery store, take a stroll to grab a cup of coffee, or to pick up that take-out you've been craving. Plus, there is a Healthy Ride Bike Station nearby and Hobart Court is a stop on Walnut Capital's resident shuttle route that goes around Pittsburgh's East End! You're a student? Lucky you! There are stops at CMU and PITT.

How would you like to live in this completely renovated Urban Retreat in one of Pittsburgh's hippest neighborhoods? Would "unobstructed skyline views" of the city be appealing to view every night as you drift off to sleep? If so, I have the perfect home for you! This 3 bedroom, 1 bathroom Single Family Home is located on Goettman Street in the heart of one of Pittsburgh's most diverse neighborhoods. 

This residence provides an urban edge along with an artsy atmosphere. Inside this home you'll find a real difference: professional series appliances, designer select finishes and cleverly designed layouts. An open floor plan and plenty of natural light creates a spacious living area. The 2nd floor master bedroom provides a tranquil relaxing atmosphere, which is exactly what you want after a stressful day of work. Other amenities include: 1st floor laundry with a commercial grade utility sink, natural stone bathroom floor, original victorian staircase, a private patio and off street parking. 

Troy Hill's vibrant neighborhood has such a unique and energetic vibe. You'll find public parks, numerous ball fields and a community garden. Enjoy your favorite gourmet coffee from "Pear and the Pickle Cafe & Market" on Rialto Street or sip an adult beverage at "Scratch Food & Beverage" on Troy Hill's main artery of Lowrie Street. Decompress by taking in the amazing city views or take a run or a bike ride along the quite streets that link to the Three Rivers Heritage Trail and Downtown. A walking neighborhood with spectacular community events makes Troy Hill a happening place to live. This home is only steps away to all these amenities.

On the water yet in the heart of Pittsburgh\u0027s historic Strip District, there\u0027s no place quite like The Cork Factory. Finally, an address that\u0027s as interesting as you are. Originally constructed in 1901 as the Armstrong Cork Factory, this landmark structure has been artfully converted into 297 Loft Apartments in the heart of Pittsburgh\u0027s popular Strip District. The nightlife, the shopping, the history, the recreation --it\u0027s yours for the taking. Wake up to a breathtaking view of the Pittsburgh skyline right outside your window. Make a latte run up the block or, better yet, brew it at home and sip it poolside or at river\u0027s edge. You can check the morning news online in the Courtyard Garden with our wireless internet access. Your day is just beginning and there\u0027s no telling where it will take you. We look forward to you making your new home at the address and location that will impress your friends, and the comfort and ease of living that will impress you! 14 ft. Exposed Ceilings, 8 ft. A distinct Pittsburgh landmark, constructed in 1921 in the midst of the downtown skyline and the Monongahela River, Terminal 21 originated as a focal point where produce and livestock met rail and industrial industries. The decades have seen this freight terminal and warehouse shift in focus to residential living, and its industrial form has long resonated with visitors and residents.Originally put to a different, industrial use, but now re-purposed to meet the current needs of a constantly evolving city, Terminal 21 fits with Pittsburghs culture of reinvention. Industry was once the heart that drove the energy of the city. Now, the emerging technological economy means room for growth within the community and for the professionals who live in it.With a comfortable modern feel inspired by the sites local heritage and history, Terminal 21 allows you to make the most of urban living. Centrally located, and primed for easy access to attractions and events throughout the city, Terminal 21 is still the center of a vibrant community and a welcoming stop on lifes journey.

Shadyside Commons offers newly renovated 1- and 2- bedroom apartments that combine a contemporary living space with a peaceful environment in the coveted Shadyside neighborhood of Pittsburgh. Built in 1903, the building was constructed as a hardware store for Pittsburgh businessman John Bindle and, over a century later, the 4-story brick building still flaunts its unusually sharp style and quality details. Large brick arches, handsome cornices and oversized industrial windows couple with proximity to downtown Pittsburgh to create your perfect luxury residence. Apartments include modern kitchens and baths, ample closet space with adjustable shelving and custom storage, and in-suite washers \u0026 dryers. Located near the University of Pittsburgh, UPMC-Shadyside, and Carnegie Mellon, Shadyside Commons offers easy access to the city\u0027s parks, shopping, and restaurants, in the vibrant, yet cozy residential neighborhood of Shadyside. A distinct Pittsburgh landmark, constructed in 1921 in the midst of the downtown skyline and the Monongahela River, Terminal 21 originated as a focal point where produce and livestock met rail and industrial industries. The decades have seen this freight terminal and warehouse shift in focus to residential living, and its industrial form has long resonated with visitors and residents.Originally put to a different, industrial use, but now re-purposed to meet the current needs of a constantly evolving city, Terminal 21 fits with Pittsburghs culture of reinvention. Industry was once the heart that drove the energy of the city. Now, the emerging technological economy means room for growth within the community and for the professionals who live in it.With a comfortable modern feel inspired by the sites local heritage and history, Terminal 21 allows you to make the most of urban living. Centrally located, and primed for easy access to attractions and events throughout the city, Terminal 21 is still the center of a vibrant community and a welcoming stop on lifes journey.

A distinct Pittsburgh landmark, constructed in 1921 in the midst of the downtown skyline and the Monongahela River, Terminal 21 originated as a focal point where produce and livestock met rail and industrial industries. The decades have seen this freight terminal and warehouse shift in focus to residential living, and its industrial form has long resonated with visitors and residents.Originally put to a different, industrial use, but now re-purposed to meet the current needs of a constantly evolving city, Terminal 21 fits with Pittsburghs culture of reinvention. Industry was once the heart that drove the energy of the city. Now, the emerging technological economy means room for growth within the community and for the professionals who live in it.With a comfortable modern feel inspired by the sites local heritage and history, Terminal 21 allows you to make the most of urban living. Centrally located, and primed for easy access to attractions and events throughout the city, Terminal 21 is still the center of a vibrant community and a welcoming stop on lifes journey.

Centrally located 1 bedroom apartment in Squirrel Hill. 
This is a rear upstairs apartment of a three unit building one block from the Forbes Avenue business strip. You share a hallway with the apartment across the hall. The owner lives in the downstairs unit.
Your apartment has a view of the backyard trees. It has a large master bedroom with two nice closets. In the hallway between the master bedroom and bathroom is a large walk-in-closet, sometimes used as an office. The hallway also has a linen closet. The kitchen is eat-in, with a pantry and cabinets. Our building was built in 1901 and has been lovingly cared for.

On the water yet in the heart of Pittsburgh\u0027s historic Strip District, there\u0027s no place quite like The Cork Factory. Finally, an address that\u0027s as interesting as you are. Originally constructed in 1901 as the Armstrong Cork Factory, this landmark structure has been artfully converted into 297 Loft Apartments in the heart of Pittsburgh\u0027s popular Strip District. The nightlife, the shopping, the history, the recreation --it\u0027s yours for the taking. Wake up to a breathtaking view of the Pittsburgh skyline right outside your window. Make a latte run up the block or, better yet, brew it at home and sip it poolside or at river\u0027s edge. You can check the morning news online in the Courtyard Garden with our wireless internet access. Your day is just beginning and there\u0027s no telling where it will take you. We look forward to you making your new home at the address and location that will impress your friends, and the comfort and ease of living that will impress you! 14 ft. Exposed Ceilings, 8 ft. A distinct Pittsburgh landmark, constructed in 1921 in the midst of the downtown skyline and the Monongahela River, Terminal 21 originated as a focal point where produce and livestock met rail and industrial industries. The decades have seen this freight terminal and warehouse shift in focus to residential living, and its industrial form has long resonated with visitors and residents.Originally put to a different, industrial use, but now re-purposed to meet the current needs of a constantly evolving city, Terminal 21 fits with Pittsburghs culture of reinvention. Industry was once the heart that drove the energy of the city. Now, the emerging technological economy means room for growth within the community and for the professionals who live in it.With a comfortable modern feel inspired by the sites local heritage and history, Terminal 21 allows you to make the most of urban living. Centrally located, and primed for easy access to attractions and events throughout the city, Terminal 21 is still the center of a vibrant community and a welcoming stop on lifes journey.

A distinct Pittsburgh landmark, constructed in 1921 in the midst of the downtown skyline and the Monongahela River, Terminal 21 originated as a focal point where produce and livestock met rail and industrial industries. The decades have seen this freight terminal and warehouse shift in focus to residential living, and its industrial form has long resonated with visitors and residents.Originally put to a different, industrial use, but now re-purposed to meet the current needs of a constantly evolving city, Terminal 21 fits with Pittsburghs culture of reinvention. Industry was once the heart that drove the energy of the city. Now, the emerging technological economy means room for growth within the community and for the professionals who live in it.With a comfortable modern feel inspired by the sites local heritage and history, Terminal 21 allows you to make the most of urban living. Centrally located, and primed for easy access to attractions and events throughout the city, Terminal 21 is still the center of a vibrant community and a welcoming stop on lifes journey.

Originally known as the Commonwealth Trust Bank, this historic tower has been serving the people of Downtown Pittsburgh for over a hundred years. Today, the building has been reborn—with stunning, light-filled modern apartment homes and amazing amenities, all within a timeless monument right in Pittsburgh’s Fourth Avenue Historic District. Throughout the iconic tower, you’ll find some of the best amenity spaces in Pittsburgh. Come explore, and you’ll find a stunning outdoor roof terrace, a 2-story club \u0026 game room, and even a bicycle garage tucked away in the bank’s original vault. With a completely reimagined interior and unbelievable skyline and river views, The Commonwealth Building has become home to stunning boutique living spaces that combine the best of both worlds—old-world craftsmanship, with modern simplicity and style. A distinct Pittsburgh landmark, constructed in 1921 in the midst of the downtown skyline and the Monongahela River, Terminal 21 originated as a focal point where produce and livestock met rail and industrial industries. The decades have seen this freight terminal and warehouse shift in focus to residential living, and its industrial form has long resonated with visitors and residents.Originally put to a different, industrial use, but now re-purposed to meet the current needs of a constantly evolving city, Terminal 21 fits with Pittsburghs culture of reinvention. Industry was once the heart that drove the energy of the city. Now, the emerging technological economy means room for growth within the community and for the professionals who live in it.With a comfortable modern feel inspired by the sites local heritage and history, Terminal 21 allows you to make the most of urban living. Centrally located, and primed for easy access to attractions and events throughout the city, Terminal 21 is still the center of a vibrant community and a welcoming stop on lifes journey.

Originally known as the Commonwealth Trust Bank, this historic tower has been serving the people of Downtown Pittsburgh for over a hundred years. A distinct Pittsburgh landmark, constructed in 1921 in the midst of the downtown skyline and the Monongahela River, Terminal 21 originated as a focal point where produce and livestock met rail and industrial industries. The decades have seen this freight terminal and warehouse shift in focus to residential living, and its industrial form has long resonated with visitors and residents.Originally put to a different, industrial use, but now re-purposed to meet the current needs of a constantly evolving city, Terminal 21 fits with Pittsburghs culture of reinvention. Industry was once the heart that drove the energy of the city. Now, the emerging technological economy means room for growth within the community and for the professionals who live in it.With a comfortable modern feel inspired by the sites local heritage and history, Terminal 21 allows you to make the most of urban living. Centrally located, and primed for easy access to attractions and events throughout the city, Terminal 21 is still the center of a vibrant community and a welcoming stop on lifes journey.

This is a gorgeous well-maintained 3-bedroom unit on the first floor conveniently located in North Oakland/Shadyside with a great walk score 86. A distinct Pittsburgh landmark, constructed in 1921 in the midst of the downtown skyline and the Monongahela River, Terminal 21 originated as a focal point where produce and livestock met rail and industrial industries. The decades have seen this freight terminal and warehouse shift in focus to residential living, and its industrial form has long resonated with visitors and residents.Originally put to a different, industrial use, but now re-purposed to meet the current needs of a constantly evolving city, Terminal 21 fits with Pittsburghs culture of reinvention. Industry was once the heart that drove the energy of the city. Now, the emerging technological economy means room for growth within the community and for the professionals who live in it.With a comfortable modern feel inspired by the sites local heritage and history, Terminal 21 allows you to make the most of urban living. Centrally located, and primed for easy access to attractions and events throughout the city, Terminal 21 is still the center of a vibrant community and a welcoming stop on lifes journey.

A distinct Pittsburgh landmark, constructed in 1921 in the midst of the downtown skyline and the Monongahela River, Terminal 21 originated as a focal point where produce and livestock met rail and industrial industries. The decades have seen this freight terminal and warehouse shift in focus to residential living, and its industrial form has long resonated with visitors and residents.Originally put to a different, industrial use, but now re-purposed to meet the current needs of a constantly evolving city, Terminal 21 fits with Pittsburghs culture of reinvention. Industry was once the heart that drove the energy of the city. Now, the emerging technological economy means room for growth within the community and for the professionals who live in it.With a comfortable modern feel inspired by the sites local heritage and history, Terminal 21 allows you to make the most of urban living. Centrally located, and primed for easy access to attractions and events throughout the city, Terminal 21 is still the center of a vibrant community and a welcoming stop on lifes journey.

A distinct Pittsburgh landmark, constructed in 1921 in the midst of the downtown skyline and the Monongahela River, Terminal 21 originated as a focal point where produce and livestock met rail and industrial industries. The decades have seen this freight terminal and warehouse shift in focus to residential living, and its industrial form has long resonated with visitors and residents.Originally put to a different, industrial use, but now re-purposed to meet the current needs of a constantly evolving city, Terminal 21 fits with Pittsburghs culture of reinvention. Industry was once the heart that drove the energy of the city. Now, the emerging technological economy means room for growth within the community and for the professionals who live in it.With a comfortable modern feel inspired by the sites local heritage and history, Terminal 21 allows you to make the most of urban living. Centrally located, and primed for easy access to attractions and events throughout the city, Terminal 21 is still the center of a vibrant community and a welcoming stop on lifes journey.

Shadyside Commons offers newly renovated 1- and 2- bedroom apartments that combine a contemporary living space with a peaceful environment in the coveted Shadyside neighborhood of Pittsburgh. Large brick arches, handsome cornices and oversized industrial windows couple with proximity to downtown Pittsburgh to create your perfect luxury residence. Apartments include modern kitchens and baths, ample closet space with adjustable shelving and custom storage, and in-suite washers \u0026 dryers. Located near the University of Pittsburgh, UPMC-Shadyside, and Carnegie Mellon, Shadyside Commons offers easy access to the city\u0027s parks, shopping, and restaurants, in the vibrant, yet cozy residential neighborhood of Shadyside. A distinct Pittsburgh landmark, constructed in 1921 in the midst of the downtown skyline and the Monongahela River, Terminal 21 originated as a focal point where produce and livestock met rail and industrial industries. The decades have seen this freight terminal and warehouse shift in focus to residential living, and its industrial form has long resonated with visitors and residents.Originally put to a different, industrial use, but now re-purposed to meet the current needs of a constantly evolving city, Terminal 21 fits with Pittsburghs culture of reinvention. Industry was once the heart that drove the energy of the city. Now, the emerging technological economy means room for growth within the community and for the professionals who live in it.With a comfortable modern feel inspired by the sites local heritage and history, Terminal 21 allows you to make the most of urban living. Centrally located, and primed for easy access to attractions and events throughout the city, Terminal 21 is still the center of a vibrant community and a welcoming stop on lifes journey.

Built in 1928 as a hotel originally and remodeled into apartments mid-century, the building has 7 stories, 1 passenger elevator, 1 freight elevator, 2 stairwells. Coin operated laundry is available in the basement. All utilities are included in the rent. The apartments at The Frontenac include one bedrooms, studios, and efficiencies. On each floor there are 9 studios, 1 efficiency and 1 one bedroom for a total of 70 units. The apartments all get lots of daylight and all have hardwood floors in the living areas.Flexible.

Holiday Park is well-planned, self contained community that\u0027s an integral part of the Pittsburgh area. Within minutes of Holiday Park you will find excellent schools, public transportation, shopping, medical offices, recreation, sports programs, day care facilities and fitness facilities. Located off of Route 286 to Business 22 you will find it convenient to the Pennsylvania Turnpike, the Parkway East, Pittsburgh, Greensburg, Oakland, Shadyside and Squirrel Hill. Enjoy a night out at the Waterfront or South side. Close to the Monroeville Mall you will find great shopping, entertainment and wonderful restaurants. A few of the many highlights of our townhomes include patios, garages, and the conveniences of in house laundry rooms, many include full size washers and dryers. Some of the apartment homes have private balconies for you to relax and enjoy your leisure moments. We also have laundry facilities and off street parking. The two and three bedroom luxury townhomes, nestled in an elegant setting, offer 2.5 baths, eat-in kitchens, dining rooms, garage, balcony and a fireplace. A distinct Pittsburgh landmark, constructed in 1921 in the midst of the downtown skyline and the Monongahela River, Terminal 21 originated as a focal point where produce and livestock met rail and industrial industries. The decades have seen this freight terminal and warehouse shift in focus to residential living, and its industrial form has long resonated with visitors and residents.Originally put to a different, industrial use, but now re-purposed to meet the current needs of a constantly evolving city, Terminal 21 fits with Pittsburghs culture of reinvention. Industry was once the heart that drove the energy of the city. Now, the emerging technological economy means room for growth within the community and for the professionals who live in it.With a comfortable modern feel inspired by the sites local heritage and history, Terminal 21 allows you to make the most of urban living. Centrally located, and primed for easy access to attractions and events throughout the city, Terminal 21 is still the center of a vibrant community and a welcoming stop on lifes journey.

A distinct Pittsburgh landmark, constructed in 1921 in the midst of the downtown skyline and the Monongahela River, Terminal 21 originated as a focal point where produce and livestock met rail and industrial industries. The decades have seen this freight terminal and warehouse shift in focus to residential living, and its industrial form has long resonated with visitors and residents.Originally put to a different, industrial use, but now re-purposed to meet the current needs of a constantly evolving city, Terminal 21 fits with Pittsburghs culture of reinvention. Industry was once the heart that drove the energy of the city. Now, the emerging technological economy means room for growth within the community and for the professionals who live in it.With a comfortable modern feel inspired by the sites local heritage and history, Terminal 21 allows you to make the most of urban living. Centrally located, and primed for easy access to attractions and events throughout the city, Terminal 21 is still the center of a vibrant community and a welcoming stop on lifes journey.

A distinct Pittsburgh landmark, constructed in 1921 in the midst of the downtown skyline and the Monongahela River, Terminal 21 originated as a focal point where produce and livestock met rail and industrial industries. The decades have seen this freight terminal and warehouse shift in focus to residential living, and its industrial form has long resonated with visitors and residents.Originally put to a different, industrial use, but now re-purposed to meet the current needs of a constantly evolving city, Terminal 21 fits with Pittsburghs culture of reinvention. Industry was once the heart that drove the energy of the city. Now, the emerging technological economy means room for growth within the community and for the professionals who live in it.With a comfortable modern feel inspired by the sites local heritage and history, Terminal 21 allows you to make the most of urban living. Centrally located, and primed for easy access to attractions and events throughout the city, Terminal 21 is still the center of a vibrant community and a welcoming stop on lifes journey.

Shadyside Commons offers newly renovated 1- and 2- bedroom apartments that combine a contemporary living space with a peaceful environment in the coveted Shadyside neighborhood of Pittsburgh. Built in 1903, the building was constructed as a hardware store for Pittsburgh businessman John Bindle and, over a century later, the 4-story brick building still flaunts its unusually sharp style and quality details. Large brick arches, handsome cornices and oversized industrial windows couple with proximity to downtown Pittsburgh to create your perfect luxury residence. Apartments include modern kitchens and baths, ample closet space with adjustable shelving and custom storage, and in-suite washers \u0026 dryers. The Foundry at 41st is bravely setting new standards for apartment living. Come home to comfort, luxury and endless amenities.
